title: WEEK 2
content:
### Definitions
- $b$: maximum branching factor (could be infinite)
- $d$: the depth of shallowest goal node (finite)
- $m$: maximum path length (could be infinite)
- $C^{*}$: cost of the optimal solution
- $\epsilon$: minimal cost of an action

### Search Strategies

### Uninformed Search
Uninformed search strategies use no information about the likely “direction” of the goal node(s). Also known as blind search.
- Breadth-first
- Depth-first
- Depth-limited
- uniform-cost
- Depth-first iterative deepening
- Bidirectional

### Bread-First Search (BFS)

#### Charateristics
- complete?
    - yes, if $b$ is finite
- Optimal?
    - yes, if path cost is equal to depth
- Time complexity = $O(b^{d + 1})$
- Space complexity = $O(b^{d + 1})$

### Uniform-Cost Search (UCS)
Uniform-cost search is BFS with priority queue in function of cost. BFS is UCS with constant cost edges.

#### Characteristics
- complete?
    - yes, given a finite number of nodes
- Optimal?
    - yes
- Time complexity = $O(b^{\frac{C^{*}}{\epsilon + 1}}) \geq O(b^{d + 1})$
- Space complexity = $O(b^{\frac{C^{*}}{\epsilon + 1}}) \geq O(b^{d + 1})$

### Depth-First Search (DFS)

#### Characteristics
- Complete? 
    - yes, if $m$ is finite
- Optimal?
    - No
- Time complexity = $O(b^{m})$
- Space complexity = $O(bm)$

### Depth-Limited Search (DLS)
Depth-limited search is DFS with a depth bound of $l$.

#### Characteristics
- Complete? 
    - yes, $d <= l$
- Optimal?
    - No
- Time complexity = $O(b^{l})$
- Space complexity = $O(bl)$

### Iterative Deepening Search (IDS)
Iterative deepening search is DLS, but if no solutions were found up to $l$, then the search depth is deepened by $l$ iteratively.

#### Characteristics
- Complete? 
    - yes, if $b$ is finite
- Optimal?
    - yes, if path cost is equal to depth
- Time complexity = $O(b^{d})$
- Space complexity = $O(bd)$

### Informed Search
Informed search strategies use information about the domain to head in the general direction of the goal node(s). Also known as heuristic search.
- Hill climbing
- Best-first
- Greedy search
- Beam, A, A*
